meanings.definition: To employ for wages or salary
meanings.sent1: The company decided to hire new employees to help with the busy season.
meanings.sent2: She will hire a plumber to fix the leaky faucet in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: I tried to hire a cat to catch the mouse, but it just slept all day.
meanings.sent4: His skills were so impressive that the company had to hire him on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant will hire extra staff for the upcoming event.

meanings.definition: The act of hiring or being hired
meanings.sent1: The hire of a new manager brought fresh ideas to the team.
meanings.sent2: After the hire, the office felt more energetic and productive.
meanings.sent3: The hire of a clown for the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The new hire quickly became friends with the rest of the team.
meanings.sent5: The company celebrated the successful hire with a party.

meanings.definition: Payment for the temporary use of something
meanings.sent1: The bike rental shop charges a reasonable hire fee for their bicycles.
meanings.sent2: The hire of a car for the weekend made the road trip much more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't believe the high hire cost for borrowing the fancy dress.
meanings.sent4: The hire of a boat for the day allowed us to explore the lake.
meanings.sent5: The theater offers costume hire for those attending the masquerade ball.
